intro: Boscia holstii, commonly known as the African wild pear, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its thick, rugged trunk and alternate, pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by fleshy, orange-red fruits that are edible but have a strong, sour taste. Boscia holstii is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh climates. It also has traditional uses in local medicine and as a source of food for wildlife.
